etymology.description: Originally designated as a combination of 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") and 木(木) (mù, "tree"), depicting a person standing still with an astonished mouth open under a tree, the character 呆 evolved as a variant of 保(保) (bǎo, "to protect") in historical contexts.
etymology.interpretation: The character 呆 conveys a sense of being motionless or stagnant, akin to a tree. Over time, it developed to express feelings of being dazed or dull, illustrating a motionless or blank state of mind.

examples.chinese: 他看起来很呆(他看起来很呆)。
小明呆住了(小明呆住了)，眼神迷茫(眼神迷茫)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎomíng dāi zhù le, yǎnshén mímáng.
examples.english: Xiaoming was stunned, his eyes were vacant.
